intro: Rubus tereticaulis var. laetus, commonly known as the western blackberry, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when mature. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained soils and full sun. Botanically, it is classified within the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other brambles and blackberry species.
